original: GRAFFMAN, Johan Holger, Civilingenjör, Mariningenjör l:a gr fi res, Danderyd, f He-denlunda, Sörml, 2/10 97 av godsäg J A G o Signe Greijmer, gm Julie Hubrecht. Marin-ing.elev 14, studex Linkp 15, marining.asp 15, HHS, civ.ing 19, marining.stip, stud Bergsunds Mek Verkst fartygsavd 19, stud varv o verkst Engl o USA 20—21, e marining 21, ma-rining 2. gr i res 23, 1. gr 32. Repr f Atlas Diesel h SKF Rio de Janeiro 23—27, presid Cia Mexicana de Cerillos y Fosforos S. A. Mexico City o div andra uppdr 27—35, vkst dir AB Transfer Sthlm sed. 35, styr.led där. Ag fastigh Blomsterstigen 10 o 11 Danderyd. Ch sv marinkomm t Ital 39—40. Styr.led div utl föret. Resor: Tyskl 12, USA, Canada, Irl 20—21, Tyskl, Danm, Engl 22—23, Engl, Port, Brasil, Frankr, Ital, Österr, Tjeckoslov, Tyskl 24—27, Belg, Frankr, Engl, Tyskl, USA, Cuba, Mex 28, Mex, USA, Canada, Centralam, Co-lumb, Cuba, Västind, Nordafr, Eur 28—35, hela Eur, särsk Balkan o Sydeur, 35—37, Engl, Frankr, Holl, Ital, Tyskl, USA, Mex, Canada 37—39, Ital 39—40, Tyskl, Österr, Ung, Rumän 43. Av trycket: Div tidskr- o tidn.art. RVO, KItKrO; KAK, KSSS, KSA, Sthlms Yachtklubb, Travellers. Hobbies: Segling, böcker.
translated: GRAFFMAN, Johan Holger, Civil Engineer, Naval Engineer 1st Class, Danderyd, born in Hed-enlunda, Sörml, on October 2, 1897, son of landowner J A G and Signe Greijmer, married to Julie Hubrecht. Naval engineering apprentice in 1914, studied at Linköping in 1915, naval engineering assistant in 1915, HHS, graduated as a civil engineer in 1919, naval engineering scholarship recipient, studied at Bergsunds Mek Verkst shipyard division in 1919, studied at shipyards and workshops in England and the USA from 1920 to 1921, became a naval engineer in 1921, promoted to naval engineer 2nd grade in 1923, 1st grade in 1932. Representative for Atlas Diesel in Rio de Janeiro from 1923 to 1927, president of Cia Mexicana de Cerillos y Fosforos S. A. in Mexico City and other various assignments from 1927 to 1935, deputy managing director of AB Transfer in Stockholm since 1935, board member there. Owns properties at Blomsterstigen 10 and 11 in Danderyd. Chief Swedish naval attaché to Italy from 1939 to 1940. Board member of various foreign companies. Traveled to Germany in 1912, USA, Canada, Ireland in 1920-1921, Germany, Denmark, England in 1922-1923, England, Portugal, Brazil, France, Italy, Austria, Czechoslovakia, Germany in 1924-1927, Belgium, France, England, Germany, USA, Cuba, Mexico in 1928, Mexico, USA, Canada, Central America, Colombia, Cuba, West Indies, North Africa, Europe in 1928-1935, entire Europe, particularly the Balkans and Southern Europe in 1935-1937, England, France, Holland, Italy, Germany, USA, Mexico, Canada in 1937-1939, Italy in 1939-1940, Germany, Austria, Hungary, Romania in 1943. Author of various journal and newspaper articles. Received the Royal Order of Vasa, the Royal Order of Kalākaua, the Knight of the Order of the Amaranth, member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, member of the Royal Swedish Yacht Club, Travellers Club. Hobbies: Sailing, books.
